body_html:
I was using command line tools and xcode 8.2. I tried the former command line tools with xcode 9.3.1 as well? But I believe you are correct that the problem is somewhere in the gcc universe. The card isn't external -- I have geforce 750M GT onboard. It's not fast by modern GPU standards, but should be a lot faster than CPU. It has nvidia compute power (or whatever exactly they call it) 3.0.
…
On Tue, May 22, 2018 at 6:20 AM, Hongbin Liu ***@***.***> wrote: Cuda9.1 + cudnn 7 + 10.13.4 + egpu works for me, gotta make sure the gcc version and the command are correct though. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body:
I was using command line tools and xcode 8.2. I tried the former command
line tools with xcode 9.3.1 as well? But I believe you are correct that the
problem is somewhere in the gcc universe. The card isn't external -- I have
geforce 750M GT onboard. It's not fast by modern GPU standards, but should
be a lot faster than CPU. It has nvidia compute power (or whatever exactly
they call it) 3.0.

On Tue, May 22, 2018 at 6:20 AM, Hongbin Liu <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Cuda9.1 + cudnn 7 + 10.13.4 + egpu works for me, gotta make sure the gcc
> version and the command are correct though.
>
> —
